hackathon-description-text: MVHacks is a high school hackathon hosted at Hacker Dojo and organized
hackathon-rules: Be nice, respectful, and have fun! Hackers are expected to behave appropriately and safely at all times.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Raspberry Pi Zero W Starter Kits

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=3350 Thomas Rd, Santa Clara, CA 95054, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: What is the current working state of your project at the end of hacking? That is the most emphasized area for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place. Projects will be ranked using Gavel, an algorithmic comparison judging system developed by HackMIT.
How original is the idea? Did you solve any challenges in a creative way?
How friendly is the UI? Is it intuitive and easy to understand?
Does the project solve a solution to a real-world problem?

hackathon-location-address: 3350 Thomas Rd, Santa Clara, CA 95054, USA
hackathon-description-header: 1 Day, 120 Hackers - Bay Area High School Hackathon
